    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameBoard​(Algorithims game)
      Constructor for the GameBoard class Initializes the game and sets the layout to null, builds the board, and sets up the feedback pegs

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void buildBoard()
      Build the board by creating holes for each row and column Holes are added to the panel and positioned accordingly
      private int calculateXPositionForPeg​(int col)
      Calculate the x-coordinate for the peg in the given column
      private int calculateYPositionForRow​(int row)
      Calculate the y-coordinate for the row
      private void loadBoardImage()
      Load the board image from the images folder and sets the preferred size of the board
      protected void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Paints the board image on the panel, overriding the paintComponent method
      void rebuildBoard()
      Rebuild the board by removing all components, rebuilding the board, setting up the feedback pegs, and repainting the board To be used when resetting the game
      private void setupFeedbackPegs()
      Set up the feedback pegs by creating a 2D array of feedback pegs Feedback pegs are added to the panel by calculating the x and y positions for sets of 4 per row
      void updateActiveRow()
      Update the active row by enabling the current row and disabling others Loops through all components and sets the active row based on the current row in the game Used to lock the user's input to the current row
      static void updateFeedbackPegs​(int row, int[] feedback)
      Update the feedback pegs for the given row with the feedback array Feedback array contains counts of black and white pegs Loops through the feedback pegs for the given row and sets the color based on the feedback array
